name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. Clement J. LUDWIG, Appellant; COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. George M. LAUGHLIN, Appellant

judges: Before EAGEN, C. J., and O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX, MANDERINO and PACKEL, JJ.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. Clement J. LUDWIG, Appellant. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. George M. LAUGHLIN, Appellant.

opinions.text:
ORDER OF COURT
PER CURIAM.
The appeal is dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Thomas J. McCormack, Philadelphia, for appellant.
LeRoy S. Zimmerman, Dist. Atty., Reid H. Weingarten, Deputy Dist. Atty., Harrisburg, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
377 A.2d 1268
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. Clement J. LUDWIG, Appellant. COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. George M. LAUGHLIN, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued May 23, 1977.
Decided Oct. 7, 1977.
Thomas J. McCormack, Philadelphia, for appellant.
LeRoy S. Zimmerman, Dist. Atty., Reid H. Weingarten, Deputy Dist. Atty., Harrisburg, for appellee.
Before EAGEN, C. J., and O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX, MANDERINO and PACKEL, JJ.
